G5W2uP39FwkVyAN_B37ecw.text: First time at this place and it was a winner!  No wait time on a Sunday, though the waiting area was full.  We were a party of two, so we lucked out on an open table.  My omelet came out incorrectly, but the waiter was helpful in fixing the situation.  I upgraded to the Red Velvet pancakes.  I'm a huge fan of Red Velvet cupcakes, so I had to give it a shot.  It was so yummy, moist, and just all around delicious!  I will definitely come back for more!

_D9Rwq3MQnZ2WHmIpYHkhg.text: Yup the Adobo fried rice and red velvet pancake delivered. Both were so good!

YUOA3McD_n5aDgA0fDCIpA.text: Went here around 8 am on a Thursday morning. It was pretty empty, but when we were leaving, we noticed that it had close to no tables left, so it gets busy! Garlic fried rice is a must. The red velvet pancakes were sweet but really delicious. Service was good as well. I'll be going back!

BsR97Ezrd4syv5GeCdgX2A.text: Baby Stacks is one of my favorite breakfast spots in Las Vegas.  Good service and great food.  Expect a wait.  It is a popular place.

zDO0-WgAFDboActGz6oPCQ.text: I don't do alot of reviews at all but This place is dissapointing i think it is all hype we waited for 30 min before we got sat.Ordered the portugese sausage with garlic fried rice,egg and red velvet pancakes sounds good right? But def not! I coulda made the garlic rice waaayyy better at home! It was like it was drenched in oil and they just threw it on the plate...as for the "so called" red velvet pancakes shit is disgusting tastes like pure flower which be covered in their "cheese syrup" if you want the REAL red velvet pancakes i suggest going to Rise & Shine...nuff said

8_oA0Ot2-a8iGmq19ARuqw.text: The breakfast here never disappoints, the pancakes are always different and good. We have even at the location in Summerlin. Just have to watch what time you come because there can be a long wait at times but what breakfast place on Sunday morning isn't busy.

COYV6fSWCGiiP-0UqpGPsA.text: As far as I'm concerned breakfast is the best meal of the day. I love funky spots like this one. I've been here a couple of times and have tried a savory dish and a pancake dish every time. THE GOOD: the pancakes are amazing! Not only are they cooked flawlessly, but there are some creative toppings. Red velvet, banana fosters, cinnamon bun & s'mores. Hands down best pancakes I've had in years. THE BAD: service isn't that attentive. There wasn't any sugar on my table and it took almost 10 mins to get the attention of a server. Also we weren't pressed on how we liked our half uneaten entrees. Which leads me to... THE UGLY: neither anyone I've gone with or myself have ever gotten a savory dish that was good. The Kailua pig Benedict's sounded great, but I was eventually grateful they don't give you much pig. Pretty flavorless. This last time I tried the chili loco moco special. Horrible! Hamburger was dry, egg over cooked and it was served over dry jasmine rice. Why would you ever do loco moco over jasmine rice? Bottom line if you want pancakes come here. If they had been average I would have given this place 1 star.

mDa8dczeNflJPc3UmjUqsg.text: I loved it here I have red velvet pancakes and honesty it was the best. It was totally worth the drive to come to vegas just to eat here. I would totally come back again.

qeP8vk855WqLsggNssG1Lw.text: Great little place. We were seated right away, friendly staff. The Spam scramble was tasty. The Mac salad was quite good. Had bacon pancakes as well. Only downside was having to wait for extra butter for the pancakes. Overall, I would come here again. You should go check it out.

UzKt4GY1UCfjhuTx3NrOLg.text: We went here because we had been hearing about it from friends as being amazing. First off, the wait is going to be extremely long as seating is limited here. If you can withstand the wait, you will get seated very closely with other customers. We like our privacy when eating, not listening to our neighbors conversations.   Then I wasn't very hungry, so I saw the kids meals were available. It never stated anywhere on the menu that you are not able to get a kids meal over a certain age or anything. So I thought, what a great idea to get the perfect amount of food since I wasn't that hungry. Well, the waitress was very rude and would not allow it, despite me even showing her there is nothing showing an age limit. I settled on just a drink and small side item.   The food is good and prices are alright. Service once seated took a little while as well. I will not be returning, to this location at least. It really struck me badly when the waitress would not allow me to order what was on the menu. If you don't want me to order kids meals, put something on the menu stating that only under 12 or something.

XGB6qIPUBhEbrPDK4Pmdhg.text: Came here today to eat. Came with a large party and was in and out relatively fast! Everything on the menu sounds amazing! The favorites at the table We're the Cinnamon Roll pancakes, red velvet pancakes and the savory meals with Portuguese sausage were a 10 too! Very large portions for everything. The breakfast classics are served with rice/potatoes and pancakes/toast. The music made me feel like I was on an island,really chill vibe. I definitely love this place and will be trying to the one closer to me on Flamingo. Also in advance if you're with a large party know that you won't be seated till the whole party is there and they don't do split checks. There is a max of 2 cards allowed to be used. Just some tips if you plan on eating with a large party!

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Portuguese Sausage with over easy Eggs

GpLj3qi9tri99I1Q0eLShg.text: TLDR; Filipino/American breakfast. The food is alright and the place can get pretty crowded and hectic at peak hours.   Our car was trying to head back to San Diego at a good time so we opted out of eating a buffet and found this restaurant. Large amount of reviews and it's Filipino food? Sounded like a good idea. We managed to come closer to closing time so the place was empty and we were seated immediately.   There's a lot of food on their menu and it seems like they're most known for their pancakes since there were so many variations, it took up half of a side of the menu. But we weren't feeling sweet food and went for savory.   We ordered the corned beef hash and eggs and the Lolo Rick's Adobo Fried Rice.   Corned Beef: You have the option of choosing rice or potatoes and toast or pancakes. You can even get garlic rice for an extra buck! The corned beef wasn't what I was expecting...usually I've had mushier ones but theirs was crispy! It had a good flavor and it was salty. And normally that would be a bad thing but the garlic rice wasn't salty at all and the corned beef helped with that. The pancakes were whatevers to me though. It wasn't very fluffy...more stiff than other restaurants.   Adobo Fried Rice: So this dish pretty much is a fried rice omelette. I don't think the adobo meat pieces were apparent but you could taste it. Because you were eating it with the egg, there wasn't as much flavor too since I don't think the egg was salted much.   Overall, it's not a terrible restaurant but nothing gave a wow factor.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Adobo fried rice with hash browns
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned beef with garlic rice

zdRQZOdrreCUMdprnCnvGQ.text: Okay so let me start off by saying this was an oasis in a desert a True gift  long drive with no sleep and no energy left all i wanted was some tasty pancakes and some Iced Coffee sadly they didn't serve iced coffee but the waitress (sorry i don't remember her name) went above and beyond and made one anyway after I decided to settle for just a regular ol' cup of coffee. Now to the important part the pancakes i'm a big fan of anything matcha and they had some absolutely divine matcha pancakes with some sweet red bean and to top it of some sweetened condensed milk  drizzle on top exactly what I needed to kick start this Vegas trip

RjduhGDUXs9rwmejuo-u7A.text: Good service, good size of the meal Very friendly and good price. To the people like  IHOp  this not for you. Recomended to small size plate...lover..

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegie omelet...

O38cX9CBwjvOBoUas2vaog.text: So good! So tasty!  We love the location by our office so we decided to try the location by our house. It wasn't packed which is great because that means less wait for our food.   I got the Spam Scamble with the Strawberry pancakes and my partner ordered the Pigglet Scramble with the Cinnabon pancakes.  So good! I loved it! Will be returning for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pigglet Skillet on top  Spam Scramble on bottom

-SNMp0qoUPyelrc7f04NDQ.text: Aight if you haven't been here before: what r u doing?  Three words for ya: RED VELVET PANCAKES. It's the best. I'm not even kidding I had a dream where I was eating red velvet pancakes from here and it was honestly a pretty good dream. Anyways, their other pancakes r super fluffy and yummy, like I've tried them before and they're good. But they ain't no red velvet pancakes. I mean. RED. VELVET. PANCAKES.   now you may be wondering: this girl is crazy and why is she so obsessed with red velvet pancakes?  They're not too sweet, like it's a perfect balance. The syrup makes the already fluffy red velvet pancakes so moist. The chocolate chips on top add a crunch that just adds so much more texture in every bite. The whipped cream even is sweet and fluffy and cold which goes so well with the warm pancakes. The pancakes are just. So good.   If you read all this, I'm honestly impressed.

PQW7tRWtb03pUV-47yju1Q.text: Red Velvet Pancakes will not soon be forgotten.  You might think this is just some gimmick, but they are divine.   Go ahead.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red Velvet pancakes

7Lm0Jd3H4jIXb8PzewV_cQ.text: My husband and I were craving some local Hawaiian breakfast that was open early. We came across this place, & were were impressed.  When we first walked in, we were immediately greeted, & we loved the vibe. They had Hawaiian music on, and the restaurant is huge! They also had a bar area which was cool.  I ordered the spam, eggs, & rice w/a short stack of pancakes while my husband ordered the Portuguese sausage w/eggs, rice, & wheat toast. It honestly tasted like home! The only thing I was bummed out about was the rice portion. It only came with one scoop of rice while I wish it came with two scoops (like all Hawaiian breakfasts are like).  Will be coming back for sure!

k7C89EeZtH8p6oQGzk542w.text: Good food but a bit too crowded all the time. Perfect spot to order and pick up. Yummy red velvet pancakes yummmmm

JpyCds8HX-OcZdXfc82wzA.text: Baby stacks is a great little gem in Las Vegas. I really love their adobo fried rice. Delicious fluffy fried rice with chicken wrapped inside an egg. I always enjoy it with some sriracha.  The pancakes are always perfectly made, and they have really great flavor options. We usually get their signature red velvet but today we tried the white chocolate macadamia and carrot cake. We enjoyed both!   I definitely recommend this place for a nice simple brunch option.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love this adobo fried rice!
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carrot cake stack
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cookie butter French toast

GttH06BRTyyyPhLDUqrLBA.text: If life gives you lemons,  go to Babystacks and get the Oreo pancakes.  That is all. Lol.    Seriously... BEST.  PANCAKES.  EVER!! and I've been to a lot of famous pancake places in this city,  new york, Chicago,  Miami,  etc.  These are literally utter perfection.  I will note though that the Red Velvet's compared to some of their local competitors are lacking. I didn't care for these and I adore RV everything.  Stick to the Oreos/Cookies and Cream and you'll definitely thank me later!!    As for savory,  I always get the Huntington Skillet with scrambled eggs & cheddar, with some cholula hot sauce and sour cream.... OMG.  deelish!   I really like this place and I'll never go to any other Vegas breakfast spot again.  Go!  You won't regret it.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View when you sit at the bar

-4WccNcKDqVS0o6EE8VOfw.text: Vegetarian review:   -  veggie omelette: filling and fluffy. The omelette wasn't overfilled with stuff, just enough to be good, and the egg was full- bodied, not runny or flat. Filling was something like tomatoes, onions, bell peppers, and... mushrooms? Normally topped with Swiss cheese, but you can sub another type (I asked for cheddar, got pepper jack, and said it was fine. Waitress knew and offered to take it back.)  - hash browns: standard. Not really crispy, so if you like the crisp, maybe ask for well done?  You can choose toast or two pancakes, with a slight cost for anything other than your standard buttermilk pancake.   - lemon ricotta pancakes: thin, like crepes (which is what it said on the menu), and just ok. Kind of my fault for not getting something popular. Not much ricotta or lemon. Comes with cream cheese syrup which was quite good.   - red velvet pancakes: straight dessert. Very tasty, with the red velvet pancakes True to taste for a red velvet. With lots of whipped cream and the cream cheese syrup, all in all a heavy dessert, sweet and delicious.  Service was wonderful. Personable and friendly.   Parking- easy.   On a Monday morning- no wait.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon ricotta pancakes. Dusted with powdered sugar with a slice of lemon, a bit of butter and cream cheese syrup.
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie omelette with pepper jack instead of Swiss with a side of hash browns.

-4j1b2HoCX782AUTd7hgwQ.text: Las Vegas, Nevada.  Damn this spot is bomb...  Service: A Polite & Hospitable.  Food: A/B Can't wait to come back and try other pancakes.  Ranchero Egg White Omlette - Simple. Green chiles plus chicken and greens sauce. Nothing fancy. Great spice and crispyness.  Hash Browns - Commercialized. Perfectly toasted for that extra crisp. It's a double layer and useful if the omlettes and pancakes don't fill ya up. I would save this for last otherwise you might be missing out on the best part.  Interior/Decor: A Utilizes space well w/ nice wall deco.  Location: A In a strip mall off of Flamingo/Buffalo within Spring Valley. It's just far enough from the strip to avoid tourists.  Parking: B Lot is too small for the size.  Pricing: B/C Appx $15 per head  Overall: A Unique flavors, bold options and happy service. I will be returning, and coming back a lot once Los Raiders move to the 702.  Shameless IG plug @cigarcpa.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ranchero omlette

Bz8hCBHWwzraXi4baIWcJw.text: My favorite brunch place in Las Vegas, and the sole reason is because of their red velvet pancakes with cream cheese frosting/syrup. I always order the skillet with avocado, cheese and bacon and it's the perfect amount of food for one person. Every time I go there is a bit of a wait ranging from 15 minutes to an hour if you go during weekend brunch times. Their entire selection of pancakes are really great but the red velvet is simply the best if you like red velvet flavors. It's not too sweet and after you finish a stack, you kind of want more, that's how good these pancakes are.

2tAtVAsx54FoCFez6Zjx0w.text: Came here for a brunch while I was here with my friends around 1130 and there wasn't a wait. I ordered the adobo fried rice with the BabyStacks chocolate chip pancakes and it was so good! My friends ordered Kalbi and eggs & bacon and eggs also with some pancakes. I was really hoping to get some macaroni salad but they said they discontinued it. The service was good, our waitress always checked up on us as needed. I saw that they did have lunch items also but we decided on breakfast food. I'd definitely come back next time I'm here!

FKACcHr1iCTBFJW0_Y8Sxw.text: I can speak for my entire party when I say that we ordered too much food, and yet it was spectacular, and yet one of us ate everything because he doesn't like food waste.   Personally, I am not a fan of Las Vegas. Let me rephrase that, I am not a fan of the strip. There's an unmistakable wafting quality of False pretense that is dressed so glamorous yet you can still see the brown stains running down the back of the pant leg. The parts of Vegas I enjoy are the un-glamorous, non-glitzy, wear your shames and your fears and your mess on your sleeves and your face. BabyStacks is beautiful, though -- like a diamond surrounded by rubies incased in coal.   The Kalua Pig Benedict was a darling -- moderately juicy yet brimming with flavor but also tasting like every good eggs benedict you've ever had in your unremarkable but brilliant life. I also tasted two different omelettes, and if I ever learn how to do an omelette right, it's over for you (no specific 'you' just the entire universe, like 'the snap'). If you order a tre tre (entree for non-Tom Haverford people), get a baby stack or short stack, whatever it is. Don't go full stacks, people! It's too much for you.  I really don't like food waste.

4anjHG-VYUhj4Fm_97kKBg.text: This is hands down my favorite breakfast place.  And I have pretty high standards when it comes to breakfast....I don't even know where to begin..  Specialty Pancakes - 5 Stars!! You gotta try the red velvet  and pumpkin (seasonal).  The have this delicious whipped cream on top that is to die for.    Garlic Rice - 5 Stars!! Always upgrade your breakfast to include the garlic rice, it goes well with everything!  I've tried to replicate this at home and it doesn't come close.  The corn beef hash is also delicious here...so is the hash browns...I just wish they had this in California.  If you are ever in Vegas...this is a must visit.  My family goes every time.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pumpkin Spice Pancakes
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red Velvet Pancakes
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Korean Ribs with Garlic Rice

-5_aPbZkCTx00jphAAtKPg.text: This diner type spot serves alot of brekkie items with a filipino or hawaiian twist.  I didnt feel like having any pancakes or anything sweet so I got the benedict with spinach and bacon. It was good and I liked the hash browns. My only gripe is that it's a good drive away from the strip and kinda inconvenient to get to. My mom enjoyed her short stack (nutella and strawberries) and my sister enjoyed her chili loco moco type dish+white chocolate side stack. The coffee was drinkable. Nothing memorable but nothing horrible.  The price was fair for what we got.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0nOteg2lPSpOihuWGJe_Vw.text: Visited August of 2019, brunch day after my sons wedding. They took our order for 10 very hungry people 15 min before they closed. Customer service was sooooo awesome. And the food was delicious. Great place if you have a large appetite!

bZ5gngyQjKFocWO6IjeMuQ.text: 700TH REVIEW!!!!!!! I'M ON A ROLL NOW YELPERS  1st time at this location and everything was pretty much the same as other locations. Service decent, food great. I subtracted a star because it seemed to take our food FOREVER to arrive at our table, opposed to other diners. We didn't order anything extraordinary either. This location isn't near the area I'm usually in, but if I'm ever around here again I'll definitely drop in.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. German chocolate shirt stack with seasoned potatoes Portuguese sausage &amp; bacon

QqJMIlWORi5wrOu1XCCLQQ.text: Get the kahlua pork/cabbage eggs benedict!  It was delicious.  I would pass on the adobo omelette- flavorless, dry and salty.  We also ordered the bananas foster pancakes which was pretty tasty.  Overall, great breakfast spot but be prepared to wait!

0SHbjFOh-KCbS06tKI3MSg.text: bad service !!!  I was quoted 40-45 min for a table for 4 on a Sunday at 12:24pm. We decided to go 3 miles away and get a smoothie and come back. At 12:50 we checked in and said she called us at 12:39pm... I reminded her what she quoted us and she said "I said it could be up to 40-45 min"... She called us 15min after she quoted me 40-45?!? I've worked in several restaurants, it's not that hard to host.  we also started noticing other tables who ordered after us were getting their food before us. and when our food finally started coming out, it would come out in spurts.  food quality was mediocre. I got the Huntington Scramble and it was nothing special. I also had to ask different waiters several times for extra things.   definitely won't be coming back

Opn3LTJpw10FypIYH0juIg.text: This is a really unique breakfast/brunch spot, and it's definitely worth the quick drive from the Strip if you'd like to skip those $17.99 breakfast buffets in exchange for trying something new.  Try the Kalua Pig Benedict for a twist on eggs benedict - the combination of Hawaiian shredded pork and cabbage really makes the dish. Or, if you're a fan of pretending to be British and having afternoon tea, order the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes.  They're crepe-thin with an elegant lemony flavor, and the sides of fresh lemons, cream cheese syrup (way tastier than it sounds,  trust me) and powdered sugar are served prettily arranged on a delicate lacy plate.  You'd expect to pay extra for these fun dishes, but the price compares favorably to chain brunch places, with most entrees items in the $8-12 range.    I probably won't be back to Vegas for a bit, but when I return, I know where I'll be having brunch!

oaaRa1IzK0EhvhxHvktm-g.text: Their food is DELICIOUS! Seems to be busy when we go. I've made it a must-have on our way home from Las Vegas. Their staff always keeps us in check and is very sweet. Food came put quickly and always pleases our satisfaction. Wouldn't wanna have breakfast anywhere else, when we're around!

u1vfay5Jk_1XJGhB8spXHw.text: Can you say yum?!   My husband I went to baby stacks without high expectations, but boy did they deliver!   We ordered the adobo fried rice omelette, corned beef hash with rice and eggs and bananas fosters pancakes. It was all delish!  Especially the omelette!  That definitely caught me by surprised! It was extremely flavorful, without being too over powering.  The pancakes however, were not   The service however, was mediocre at best.  We had to wait when we asked for refills for our water. And it took awhile to ask for our check because we couldn't find our waiter.

wnTOovZsmpreOmoqc2Qi9Q.text: This o s a great place for breakfast I love their French toast here. The service is good, it does get a bit crowded at times bilut it is still worth it you get a great breakfast at a decent price.

M2dYbbcvjFmFSzKuFasMJg.text: I would eat there every morning if I could but I know I would only gain weight.  Love their different varieties of pancakes, my favorite red velvet.

LC5tlf2c3gS1KD14x0yGRQ.text: Don't try to order pickup. I called was placed on hold, then hung up on. the 4 times I called back guess what the line was busy. Beyond annoyed.   i had to go in to the store and have my order taken at that time. the food was good but too much hasle. it was extremely busy.

bA6iA1I6gmuVwItnM-pFQQ.text: 1pm on a weekday, no wait! Loco moco with garlic rice is DELICIOUS and the red velvet pancakes as the upgraded side is the perfect amount. Pass on the mac salad. Nice spot to check out away from the strip for a bomb meal at a much nicer price.

6MksrFTqOro0MFm2ClCXSw.text: It was incredible. The service was good and they got our food out fast. Even though it was busy, our server checked on use and made sure everything was good.   I ordered orange creamsicle pancakes and they were amazing. They aren't dyed, it's all natural and you can see the orange zest inside. I have enough food for left overs after ordering an omelette with it. I would recommend this place for breakfast any day. It's a little crowded but it's worth it.

gwyy9fb5nFbJY2RDU2X8sg.text: I can't wait to go back and Vegas and enjoy this marvelous yummy restaurant. The best pancakes ever. Great service! I have been on vacation since June 3 and this is the best restaurant we have visited.

e4-l6ap2a8h4swz_l-Dmqg.text: I LOVE PANCAKES!  And if YOU LOVE PANCAKES, this place is a MUST!  What makes this place even better is their Asian inspired breakfast items...makes the whole family happy!  We loved this place so much we came here twice during our one week vacation here in Vegas.   On both of our visits the place was crowded, but we were seated in less than 10 minutes. Service was friendly and fast. From the time we placed our order to the time we got our food, probably was only about 10 minutes.   Everything we ordered was soo good! The spam scramble w/garlic fried rice, cookies and cream pancakes, adobo fried rice, bananas foster pancakes, kalua pork grilled cheese and spam and eggs were all equally delicious!  Whether you are in the mood for sweet or savory, you can't go wrong with any of the dishes.   Just to highlight on a few: 1) The garlic fried rice is quite tasty!  Just like how my mom used to make it. Lots of garlic flavor, just enough salt and even some bits of the rice is crunchy. I like my rice like that, brings back childhood memories.   2) The Kalua pork grilled cheese was delish! The pork was smoky and had the perfect amount of saltiness to it. The Muenster and cheddar cheese made this grilled cheese oozing with cheesy goodness.   3) Bananas foster pancakes - saving the best for last! My mouth is salivating as I'm writing about these pancakes!  The pancake alone is fluffy and has great flavor. The brown sugar butter combo serves as the syrup in this dish, thank goodness. It has the right amount of sweetness and the bananas was caramelized perfectly.   I could keep going on, but you must try this place out for yourselves!!

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalhua pork Benedict w/Red velvet pancakes
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spam and eggs

vtJzUYPtKhFmrlf10WgVVQ.text: What a great bkfst spot!  Pros: - Everything tasted homemade - Friendly staff - Red velvet pancakes were delicious! Not overly sweet. The cream cheese "syrup" was a nice complement to the moist cakes. - budget-friendly, family-friendly - go for the garlic rice as a side (goes great with over-easy eggs) - don't come here if you're trying to watch your weight or have food issues. If you're going to be high-maintenance, stay home & eat a gluten-free, dairy-free, nut-free thingy.  Cons: - Food could be hotter. Our meals came out lukewarm. Not a deal breaker. Just request that your meal is served hot, that is if that's how you like it.

4VV3mYSujjQRvqFsfoTJuA.text: Have been here 3 times. First time I walked out because my girlfriend and I waited almost an hour just for drinks! 2nd time we left due to the rude employees and the insane wait time of an hour and a half as we were told. 3rd time we left because we were. Never even acknowledged but the host at the front door. So after walking up twice, obviously too wrapped up in his conversation with another employee about nothing work related we left. As we walked away he thanked us and said please come back, like we had a pleasant dining experience.  Avoid this place at all costs!

lROFUQk3Scx_3HBSr1QDBg.text: The food is always gonna be good at Baby Stacks! But what makes this place a 3 star is because of the employees. I get how busy it gets knowing that it's only open for breakfast and brunch, but it's not an excuse not to be greeted promptly and just get ignored for a long time even when you're already standing in front of the host.  Nonetheless, food is bomb. Always gonna get more. Maybe just at another branch though, not this specific baby stacks.

V2cLUqVQK2fTO20AqnWu0A.text: Christopher was our waiter who was fantastic. We walked in at 1pm and it was still pretty busy, but no wait for seating.This was our first time here so we ordered the buttermilk pancakes which were satisfactory, the eggs and ham were overcooked and had black marks from being overcooked. Our waiter told us we should have tried the flavored pancakes since that what they are known for and it being our first time.   Overall the service was better then the food, most likely wont be back.

7oX143I-ro97TEp99m57KA.text: Food was good for the most part. Customer service needs work.   I was really excited to try out Babystacks for the first time and it all started out looking good. They had a good selection of pancakes and it was so hard for me to decide which one I wanted, especially since they don't come with any meat. We ended up going with an entree and upgrading our side to a baby stack so that we could try out some flavors.   The adobo omelette was tasty and a good sized portion. The red velvet pancakes we got as it's side was also really yummy.  They were moist and the cream cheese syrup wasn't overly sweet. All in all we were very pleased.   Now our second entree was ordered later (since I couldn't decide what I wanted) and ended up coming out just as we finished our first dish. We were severely disappointed this time around.   The chocolate chip macadamia nut pancakes were alright...they didn't taste too bad, but they were pretty dry. The two pancakes instantly soaked up all the syrup we poured on them and texture was dry, sticky, and all wrong. Not enjoyable at all, but at least they didn't taste disgusting.   Then came the baby chick skillet. The eggs we ordered over easy were cooked perfectly, but the entire dish lacked flavor. The chicken was microscopic because we literally found one piece that was smaller than the potato cubes. And to top it off, I found a piece of hard packaging plastic in my second bite.   We stopped eating and brought it to our waitress's attention. She took the plate back and somebody else came out to talk to us about it. This lady inquired about where we found the plastic and when we told her, she  said that was weird because everything in the dish is freshly made and not packaged. That's exactly what I thought, but there is no excuse for foreign objects to be found in food and it wasn't cool how accusingly she spoke to us, as if we were the ones who put it there.   Then they tried to give us a 20% discount on the meal instead of taking the skillet off the tab completely. This was very upsetting considering we only had three bites in all and left the rest of the dish untouched (including that tiny piece of chicken that was only found after thorough inspection). It was only after my boyfriend insisted they take the skillet off that they proceeded to do so. We still tipped our waitress $5, but I left extremely unhappy about how they handled the whole situation.

CMh-Hq-3CQbNtZ0AgjfM1g.text: Had family breakfast everybody was happy with the food... it has a comfy feel to it great if you don't just want a chain breakfast experience. Service was nice and friendly only thing the never refilled any of our drinks

GOhmE4lD2ublwH3QWrVbxw.text: I wanna say that this place has the best red velvet pancakes! I couldn't decide between the famous red velvet pancakes and white truffle with macadamia nut pancakes, so I got a small order of both. The white truffle pancakes was good, but red velvet pancakes was so much better!!!   We also ordered Kailua Pig Eggs Benedict with seasoned potatoes, and I can only say "Yummy!"   We went there on Sunday morning around 9:30, just to avoid the rush hour for brunch, and we got seated within 5 minutes. The waitress was nice and patient. The price was good considering the portion that you get. Definitely worth the 15 minutes driving from strip!

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My favorite the famous Red Velvet Pancakes!
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. White Truffle with Macadamia nut Pancakes
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kailua Pig Eggs Benedict

n9Naq5qbxMvc5EoJykLx4g.text: This is absolutely one of my new favorite local breakfast spots! They have many different varieties of pancakes, all which are very delicious. And always keep a watch out for their specials as they are amazing.  I've been here about a half a dozen times for breakfast now, & I have to say that I will now be a regular almost every week. They have friendly wait staff always delicious meals. It's never a hit and miss. It's always very good and consistent.   I'm usually a healthy eater so I only come here on my cheat days but when I do cheat, I come to babystacks.  Grade A in my book!

Z8VHST4wepyByKWzuaif-Q.text: Visiting LV and found BabyStacks Cafe on Yelp, of course!  OMG!  What can I say other than Kudos to you guys!  EVERYTHING WAS DELICIOUS!!  EVERYTHING!  I'll make it simple with our orders of five. 1. Ham & Eggs: (2 eggs, hash brown, ham & 2 pancakes) Deelish! 2. Pilipino Omelette:It was different.   Not use to rice with eggs but it was worth trying!  Excellent! 3. Velvet Pancakes: DELICIOUS! 4. Steak and eggs: Made to perfection. Super Good! 5. Waffles & Eggs:  Yummy  I'm glad we stopped by today!  It was worth it and satisfactory!  =)  Cheers!

qxQdE9SO-IcQ-uSfmRUs2w.text: Super breakfast! My husband and I split an omelette and it was plenty.  Our daughter got pancakes and they were delicious!

QhDhDWkONARnhVPXQ4J72g.text: WOOOOOOOOOOOW....breakfast was GOOOOOOOOOOD. My prior breakfast here was good, but this time it was so much better! We both ordered the skillet. When it came, it was not at all as I imagined but WOW! It was so delicious. We also ordered a side of pancakes and they were tasty too. The service was good, the prices were good and the skillet was killer! I am going back again soon to have it again. The potatoes were so tasty. Cooked to perfection! If you come here, get a skillet. It's awesome!

AIIfTrwDGtc0ueOPDN9utg.text: Ok so they get busy and sometimes you have to wait We have had both great and mediocre service The good stuff, the food Every pancake flavor is great, cremesicle, red velvet, lemon ricotta, to name a few My favorite sweet creme crepes with or without fruit Coffee is decent but everyone has their own taste when it comes to coffee Is without a doubt a breakfast must try.

HYCIwNGp8E5vkxaJUDfiaQ.text: Best breakfast .. food are great .. this is one of the place I go to beside rise and shine ..

hJzpIhVbdWDTH4ZcScL-3w.text: Love how close this is! Fast service thought it does get busy in the morning, your guaranteed to sit fast. Cute cafe style. Lively. Amazing pancakes. Love the signature red velvet. There omelets are my favorite in town right now. Friendly staff and accommodating. There strawberry lemonade is blissful and unique!

4U_A3gaff9SgcaTTS1qU_A.text: I just moved to the neighborhood and my husband and I stopped in here to try it out based on Yelp reviews. We were not disappointed. The pancakes were out of this world! Very delicious. Our server was a really nice person and we enjoyed the visit. Make sure to ask for room temperature butter though. Cold butter and hotcakes do not mix.

tMz89PTvHjkMkOQn4ElqjQ.text: Such a delicious spot for brunch! The prices are reasonable and the wait didn't take too long. I can't wait to go back and try other specialties!   *They only seat you if your whole party is present

C4sGpzHMANsymHNGGAExGQ.text: Sadly, I think this may have been the location of my old favorite thai restaurant, Jasmine Thai...tear...but I digress.  It's a small restaurant -- and for 3 on a Saturday morning (11am-ish), the wait was awful.  There's not a big wait area inside and it was too cold to wait outside. Thankfully, we finally got in at the bar counter.  I did the BYO omelette, which is cool cause you can add one of the specialty pancakes for, like, a dollar or two.  I added the lemon ricotta pancakes.    The omelette was good but I found myself adding a ton of salt and pepper.  The pancakes, however, were awesome!  The cream cheese syrup was SO GOOD.  I literally ate everything off the my plate, scraping off the last bit of the butter, which is rare for me.  Definitely try the pancakes!

N2rxSsuucvYyMIpnn39srA.text: Delicious pancakes! The eggs and potatoes are ok but the pancakes are to die for. The red velvet and orange dreamsicle are amazing. The banyan cream pie was good but not as tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana cream pie pancakes.

1FHKtUbcjgI7Brl6y6EnKQ.text: This place was really good. The service could've been better and the pancakes were on the dense side. I ordered the Adobo fried rice since I'm Filipino and it was okay. It came wrapped in an omelet. The place was super busy and food came out fast! I would definitely comeback to try other things on the large menu :).

ugbOjiuY5T28v5RWPstu2g.text: Gotta love babystacks! When I miss Hawaii, and their awesome breakfast. I would come here to just satisfy my soul. With big portions, and great Hawaiian offerings, how could one go wrong here for breakfast? Oh, but I come for the panclocks! I had a morning date with my favorite 8 year old man Vince. Plus I owed him a good birthday breakfast so I had to make it count! The wait wasn't long at all. We were seated at a small table for two, but they were so accomodating to move us to a bigger table when my sister dropped in for breakfast last minute.   Vince ordered their orange creamsicle pancake (figures since his favorite color is after all orange.) After sampling a few bites, I would say that it tastes a lot like an orange creamsicle. The pancake is also orange. It is a fun choice for kids. the cream cheese and orange syrup was pretty delish and made for a good mix with the pancakes.   I however, ordered the lemon ricotta. It is served with three crepe like thin pancakes and fresh lemon slices with cream cheese syrup. If you are a sweedish pancake fan or even a fan of tart and sweet...THIS IS THE PANCAKE FOR YOU! Oh..it was amazing. the pancakes were thin and soft, and the tart and sweetness combo made it just the right choice. the portions are big so you will get full fast.  I also took bites of their nutella crepe which is loaded with nutella and are huge! If you love nutella or nutella crepe for that matter. do recommend theirs as well.

f6gZOZzYnDIPIwA5a5KP8w.text: Such good food and great service! This is the one place I always bring family and friends when they come into town! We've been quite a few times now, and it only gets better the more you go! Nothing we've had so far has been anything less than delicious! There's usually a wait when we arrive, but I promise it's worth the patience!

z7UrerrswnwejW-7U3q7PQ.text: Easily my favorite breakfast place. Service is fast and their food is great, especially their corned beef hash. Highly recommend this place!

3LMPdmbKueu2qSBpkuAhVQ.text: Best loco moco and blueberry pancakes in town! However, the garlic rice could use a little less garlic, last time i had it, it was really overbearing. But great service, comfortable, affordable and big proportions:)

IUkLiv-haqA9-r3lYZtskg.text: Got there Saturday morning around 9am. Waited five minutes to be seated. Ordered the Portuguese sausage with banana cream pie upgrade on the pancakes for $1.50 more. Coffee was okay (on the bitter side) and they don't have Splenda. My wife got the macadamia pancake with a side of bacon. We thought the food was decent, but nothing out of the ordinary. The pancakes tasted like they were from a mix. I liked my banana cream pie pancake very much. Sweet with lots of bananas and other sweetness. The macadamia on the other hand was just pancakes with white chocolate chip. Macadamia nuts were missing on her plate.   The staff is friendly and the drinks server was attentive.  When we left, the wait became thirty minutes. I suggest you arrive early if you want to avoid the rush. Seems like a local joint. Lots of young families, Filipinos, and regulars...

T46zWivwJoIgbqwXfTv7-Q.text: Definitely enough unique pancakes! I don't see it as amazing, but everything tasted good.  Service was a little slow, my omelette was only ok, but I if I wanted pancakes, I know I would come back.

_gVXF9G_ZD26WWgf_KfjTg.text: More like 3.5 stars. We had about a 30 min wait (Saturday brunch time) and then the hostess called our name and asked if they counter was ok or if we preferred a table. My husband said "do you have a table" and she looked around and said "uh, no." Guess we'll take the counter then! After that the service was good and food came out quickly. I like that the omelets came with pancakes and you have the option to upgrade to one of the crazy flavors. I got the red velvet because of all the reviews and DANG! They were great. They're popular for good reason. The omelet was fine, for some reason they put the cheese on the outside. Whatever. The hash browns were really good, maybe a little soggy but I was into it.

cCekZIULNiRvxuo9Aa81Vg.text: This place is so freaking good everyone should go n try it!!   went there one morning (cuz I saw they have red velvet pancake) we ordered adobo fried rice omelette, kalua pig benedict, and red velvet pancake. they have adobo fried rice omelette?!?!? waaaa is this a Filipino place?!?!? hahah anyways that omelette was freaking good!!! never taste anything like it!, n the kalua pig benedict was bomb too, love their hollandaise sauce on it! But the one that was really good was their red velvet pancake (warming: do not order the full portion cuz the half portion was massive, can't imaging the full portion). I had orgasm in my mouth when I was eating that pancake... ommggg cant wait to go back again!

MxaQgbjLyP1PJkyc--CVdQ.text: Pretty tasty toppings. Pancakes weren't the best. Price for everything was fantastic! 3.5 stars.

Nm0Fp9dVjqnpHCiVTwKDUw.text: actually this restaurant doesn't even deserve a stsr! Horrible management no customer satisfaction! I will not return to thus restaurant. Food was not edible and didn't even touch my food but they never even bother to ask if they could do anything! That top it...Horrible do not go there!

Kj4b1EiZBFE7_CO6fR3Lew.text: Was recommended to visit BabyStacks by the valet at the Palms Hotel. It was a very short drive from the hotel, we waited the half hour for a seating and were not disappointed. They have nice music playing that reminds me of my visit to Hawaii last year. The servers were cordial. Since the hotel food was soooooo expensive it was a welcome relief to see their pricing.  As far as the food. We ordered burritos, pancakes and also the Spinach Benedict. I had some of each and loved each item.  Funny... they don't bring pancake syrup with some of the pancakes. The sauces seem to be enough to dress the pancakes but we asked for syrup anyway.  If your in Vegas and want a place to eat breakfast I recommend this place. The menu is extensive.

t7V5Ok4lIeeWF-FYwNAfEA.text: Adobo fried rice omelette ...nuff said. Service was solid, expect a wait....coffee was the only complaint... I like it black and high octane...was light and watery. Other than that I'd definitely go back.

tFXFBR7oF8GBGO2Qwahf3A.text: Pretty good sit down hawaiian food breakfast cafe. I liked the omelette that I got, but since i was trying to watching my diet I really limited myself.  My firend who I ate with ate some pretty good dishes though. I liked their adobo fried rice with egg. Soooo good! Had it with a bit of sriracha and it was bomb!  i would come back again.

QqhByty9B2oQlDlznjZkjw.text: Forget your 100 year old chain diners like IHOP and Danny's and try the breakfast here. This place gives you a family feel and home cooking style breakfast with a twist. Creative yet simple pancakes and breakfast items that you can eat anytime of the day.  Service is as best as it can be almost every time and food is absolutely delicious.

l9ILDXKlZw4UsB_HqOtBKQ.text: It is rare that i get overwhelmed on what to order, but there were just to many great options. I had to go back two days just to try all the good stuff. I love to go off strip to find hidden gems and Baby Stacks is defiantly one. Very rare you find SPAM and eggs on the menu. But Pancakes is were they shine the banana cream pie pancakes were off the chart. I had to come back the next day to try the Red velvet pancakes and the Almond Joy Pancakes. i didn't get to the Orange or the lemon ricotta pancakes but i will be back.

T3AVv-KpMI-gt7QYVJTq1Q.text: Great food, great value and the service from Carlos was outstanding! Fast and friendly with food at an affordable price.

Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy burger with fries
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spam and eggs with hash browns

9l9cRxPkAFh0kwO7OQvLSw.text: 3rd time here   The previous 2 were a lot better.  Ordered theportugeuese sausage and pancakes.  The eggs I ordered had a hair in it.  The orange slice in the side seemed like it was a sun dried orange.  Side of rice ordered was barely a spoonful.  Server forgot my request and I had to walk back and ask again.  I've been here before and it was great then but now not so good.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8t_1xMMh2WNB1t9sjq48UQ.text: Hawaii in Las Vegas?! I was Airbnb-ing nearby, and before heading out to Red Rock, it was only smart to fill up my belly first. Found this place on Yelp, apparently known for its pancakes. Not that I'm a huge pancake person, but I was with someone who is picky and flapjacks is one of the few things he eats, so pancake house we went. We were there before 9am on Saturday and got ourselves a table right away. I saw a few seasonal pancake specials on the board (ex. Pumpkin pancakes). I was trying to get into a pancake mood... but then I realize I may have stumbled on something special. But before I got too excited then highly disappointed, I asked if the ENTIRE menu up for grab that morning, AND the waitress said YES!   My friend, they have Spam Scramble served with rice and a side. SPAM SCRAMBLE! There was no need to even consider anything else. I decided to try their garlic rice instead of plain white rice. I chose a side of macaroni salad. I even ordered a side of their "country gravy" (think thick brown gravy).  Best $7.95 (plus $1 for garlic rice and $0.75 for gravy) ever spent on breakfast. NOW - be warned, they aren't messing with the garlic. I could have fought Dracula himself with the amount of garlic I had on my breath. But it was good. The eggs were fluffy, mixed in were chunks of Spam-goodness. They sprinkled a little of furikake all over. At the end I mixed in some of the gravy with the rice. It was legit. Highly recommend this place, and by gosh, not just for the pancakes!

YeJ6VD9M9tt4IRUC2Qt7iA.text: Very overrated.   Pancakes were dense and not hot.  Strange setup with seating right on top of each other. I actually think Denny's has better pancakes than these.  Sorry, I really wanted to like it.

pHlPI-pKF7HrVvw_GEAD0w.text: Great breakfast and a great lunch menu too. Only downside here is that the venue is small and can get crowded. Expect a wait on weekends of about twenty minutes

jezcz34y5KbHRvm0roIeYQ.text: Wow! This place totally blew our minds and exceeded every expectation. The food is unique and you won't be able to get it anywhere else, and the prices are reasonable.  We got the red velvet pancakes, and the fried rice omelette. The omelette was perfect, not too greasy, and the red velvet pancakes were absolutely amazing.  It's a shame this place isn't open later because we would definitely visit after work if we could. Unfortunately, they close at 2 PM. Regardless, it is still five stars

xpqBv-ttJvpEFtxQeOUi6Q.text: This is a pretty good spot for the most part I would just stray away from their crepes they are really spongey.... Also I had their hazelnut pancakes which have Nutella on them and it had barely any Nutella on it at all same as the crepe my buddy from Australia had the Nutella and strawberry crepe and there were like 4 strawberries and next to no Nutella I felt like I wasted my money.

Zj9gjnXcUXsDrITB-mRKCQ.text: Honestly the worst breakfast I have ever had in my life. I had the senior breakfast. Scrambled eggs tasted like they came out of a box, the sausage tasted raw and barely resembled meat and the only thing that saved the seasoned potatoes was the ketchup. Everything was very Bland including the tiny bit of salsa they gave me for $0.75 extra. The place was packed there was about 20 minute wait at 10 o'clock in the morning. Better breakfast places would include Denny's, IHOP, or the Santa Fe Station.

2TVBx5lo4uMkPe_iTHPVwQ.text: One of our fave cafes in Vegas! I see a new flavor....Salted Caramel Pretzel Pancakes?!? Should I? Hmmmmm...yep, I did that!! They were really good!! Warm,chocolate pancakes drizzled with caramel & sprinkled with pretzels & white chocolate chips! The service is always good & everyone is hospitable.

AWNNJBKDcdOK7ySVrJhCOw.text: I really wanted to love this place. Looking at Yelp and checking all the crazy pancakes they had to offer, I was excited to try this place. When I tasted the food, excitement ended.  Let me say that the service was great. No problems in that area. I ordered the carrot cake pancakes.  Came with some icing to serve as a syrup.  I was like okay this is different...it should work.  It would have worked...if the pancakes weren't as dry as cardboard.  I felt like I was eating a carrot cake flavored notebook! I like syrup since it soaks in and helps in the event that you jack up and overcook the cakes.  The icing just sat on top and did nothing.  It was rough.  I'm not saying this place is bad.  I would give it another chance when I'm in town.  Maybe they just had an off day (with my plate).  With so many choices in pancakes, I would try it again.  Next time...better be on point tho!

6YV7FGhHY3WsrcZj9n_mMw.text: Super friendly service and great comfort food. It's a gem that only locals would know at a great price. I'd would definitely go again.

LyW6usCfHjuex6OHLuHDaA.text: Been over a year since my last review & I've visited a couple times since then so an update is due!  Service has improved. No lost tickets anymore! Lol. I've noticed they're not consistent with their red velvet pancakes but I like it nonetheless.   I'm excited to come here & try their other pancakes. They always come up with something new to create so check their chalkboard in the cashier area!

RLtVnd4-sL76WQGPnS-ydg.text: Nice little spot with Hawaiian style breakfast. Wish I can try everything on the menu they all looked so good! I got some garlic fried rice with scrambled eggs and the red velvet short stack pancakes. The pancakes are so good! But a little too cakey for me, it was very filling. Service was also good. It can get packed here on the weekends so be prepared to wait awhile especially if you have a big party.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short stack red velvet pancakes

nOasIiJQ30O8E1OsymWxDQ.text: BabyStacks we gotta talk. We've known each other for a long time, you took my red velvet pancake virginity away, but its time to part and go separate ways. I have to... eat different egg benedicts... you know???  Back in the day there was a ton of hype for BSC, all my friends were uploading pictures of their glorious pancakes. Now that hype is over and being an egg making master I've become disappointed with the eggs. The previous visits I've always had eggs that are overcooked, makes me sad. The portions have gotten smaller and isn't exactly the cheapest spot in the neighborhood. These days my tooth isn't as sweet anymore to devour their variety of pancakes. I've always thought $3 for a smaller glass of orange juice is a bit high.   While BSC does have an array of Hawaiian breakfast items, it just doesn't scream excellence or cause any cravings. However if you are determined to have your first meal of the day at BSC, my favorites were the kalua benedict, the Huntington skillet, and carrot cake pancakes.   Service has always been fine, water gets refilled, no problems with the bill, and orders are correct.  Au revoir BSC!

8bfp2nBPjJAIo5ouixG1Xg.text: always my go to brunch spot when i'm visiting vegas! when I walked in they said it was a 30-45 minute wait for a party of 4 but we got seated much quicker than that. my favorite dish so far has been the kalbi beef ribs with eggs. I upgraded to garlic rice for $1 and you can also upgrade your choice of babystack pancakes. the combos are always the perfect balance of savory and sweet! definitely recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lvpX_Hg9jhSK8UXuYI6LFw.text: Babystacks is racist I came in today for breakfast had to wait while the waitness waited on two table before they ask us if we wanted coffee. They cater to non white people. I wish I would giving no stars. Do not go here if you're black you get  treated different. From now on I'm going to be going to breakfast at Mr Mama's where they treat everybody the same and the food is way better and in the owner and all the workers are nice and they feel your coffee cup up when they see a empty cup and don't ask you if you want more coffee when they looking at an empty coffee cup. P.S not one black person works for this place.

CT3P6S1doPlFQfO6qNpsnA.text: I am still drooling when I recall those signature pancakes. This place is bomb for breakfast. We ended up here because of random circumstances, but I absolutely loved their pancakes. The only drawback is that they are VERY sweet. So you must be ok with very sweet breakfast food. If you happen to be in the area, come here and get those signature red velvet pancakes!

They open every box to go to show everyone and that slows the process down so much and cashier with dirty hands is one opening your food! Wow

WdhnNwPXaEh5kAOEGH74kQ.text: Absolutely DELICIOUS!!! My wife and I come here all the time. I order the country fried steak and eggs and I am never disappointed. Only bad thing is that they do not split checks if you plan to come in big groups...

cr7WdDtmgrqHpeS3uBSklA.text: Ordered carrot cakes and red velvet.. both were amazing! Carrot cake had a lot of flavor and red velvet was similar to chocolate cake but very fluffy! Cream cheese icing on both was very sweet but flavorful in light doses.. very good! Nervous for my figure that this place is around the corner from our place!

JVq1_loQTFcJM7Lfbu2SFg.text: This place is awesome, great service, reasonable prices, and delicious food. I liked their mix of Filipino breakfast items with traditional American. I really enjoyed the Loco Moco with a side of Adobo meat. We will definitely be back!

JaV3BO0fZ5b4wpS20vJM_g.text: When I'm this part of town. I love to go here with family. I always get Lola's omelet. My kids always get a different choice for stakes.   Service good. Food awesome  Wait time perfect. Seating both or table and they have seating for babies. Parking area open. Price regular not over price.

Pi2pfsFIHUePhSK55fLhSg.text: Used to frequent this place regularly back when I first moved to Vegas but I'm glad to come back about four years later to see that everything remained great as usual!   As expected there was a wait but even though we were quoted about 45 minutes, it ended up being only a 25 minute wait! Service was great, it was hectic but the servers and hostesses kept their cool. Major props today since it was so busy because of the holiday.   They have a wide selection to choose from on their menu. On the front, you have what you would expect from breakfast/brunch joints such as egg and meat entrees, omelettes, pancakes, and skillets. On the back, you have a variety of Asian-fusion choices.   The portions are quite large and most entrees come with potatoes or toasts on the side. When you're trying this place out for the first time, definitely get the Red Velvet Pancakes because the hype is real for those suckers. They're so fluffy and tasty! The Spam Scramble is also a must try. It looks like something your mom might make at home but Babystacks makes them with a such a tasty twist by adding Furikake.   Don't know why I stopped coming here regularly when everything is so great but I guess I shall be back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spam Scramble with garlic rice
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chick omelette with avocado

dTJhJZs6V05Z-ELoHlAYtA.text: No matter how many different breakfast spots I'll try, BabyStacks Cafe will always be one of my favorites!   I have been to every location countless times & they have the friendliest servers.   Everything I have ordered here, I enjoyed. There are so many options to choose from & I always have a hard time deciding what I want because I want it all! However, I am obsessed with their pancakes! I always have to get a short stack, even if it's to share, because their pancakes are so perfect.  You should expect there to be a wait on weekends.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

564v22q44HjfCkLhNBqxXg.text: This food is sooooooooo good, came to Vegas for vaca and have come back for breakfast several times. The tiramisu pancakes are to die for. All the skillets and omelets I've had have been amazing. Food perfectly seasoned. They always seem understaffed but the wait times weren't too crazy and the food makes up for it bringing it to 4.8 stars.

CA7i3HJuO-vnvxfUpm7r4g.text: First, I would like to mention I placed an order over the phone. I called at around 11:25 to place an order of JUST FRIES, the host Jocelyn said it would take 15 min. I showed up quite fast got there at 11:38 so I was more than willing to wait a little longer, by 11:45 I asked how much longer my side of fries would take she said 5 more minutes. When I received my order around 11:50 I was not satisfied at all !! It took WAY too long to get my order for the amount of fries I received. Very disappointed most likely not returning.

dz0sqY9H3CaBHXVZIv6kAw.text: Came here on a Friday afternoon around 2pm - an hr before they close. We got hazelnut pancakes and the special fried rice. The fried rice was good but not the best I ever had so it was just okay, nothing super special that I would come back for. The potatoes was actually pretty good - well cooked and well seasoned. The hazelnut pancakes were nice and fluffy and not too sweet which I really appreciate since most places tend to dump a whole jar of sugar in their pancakes. I think it went very well with the wiped cream on top with no additional syrup.  Overall Taste 3/5 Serice 4/5 very friendly Price: 4/5 reasonable and worth it Parking: 4/5 plenty in the lot

HfbGQn2DgW6LulwlnyIbiw.text: Yum. This was our fist time here. The food was very good but the restaurant was small. We got there at noon on a Saturday, I bet it's packed earlier in the day.

8CfXiwc0IUMy1UWEb-ykNQ.text: Great Place. I got the tip in a German Forum and tried it myself during my visit in 2014. The coffee was very good and the banana fosters short stack is absolutely delicious. For all who are in Vegas it's the place to have an awesome breakfast.

Q1IhFHfvuiyrJwZuflzpUw.text: BabyStacks is a good place to visit if you're craving an Asian breakfast or wild flavored pancakes. This is our second time at this location. My husband and I came at 730am on a Tuesday and there were already about 12 people in the restaurant. You're welcomed by the host right when you enter and we got to choose where we wanted to sit.   Service - the waiter was soft spoken and aided the kick back feel of the restaurant. She gave us some time to look over the menu after taking our drink order. Once we put down the menu she knew we were ready to order and came back to our table.   Menu - it's a big menu. In order to figure out what you wanna eat, you gotta choose what category you want to attack. From there...good luck in choosing just ONE.   Price - at first glance the prices are...pricey BUT it's because it comes with pancakes. Yes, you can have hash browns or potatoes, but don't. Upgrade your pancake!   Order - I got the Hawaiian Benedict with the cookies n cream baby stack. My husband got the Kalbi ribs and eggs with the German chocolate baby stack. Whoaaaa. The portions are pretty big and we never are able to finish our pancakes. *Con - prepare yourself to struggle eating the Kalbi ribs, but the taste is worth it!  Overall - you can't go wrong with anything you choose. You'll come back to try something else. And if you're not feeling spam, Portuguese sausage, or kalbi ribs...they have traditional choices also. But don't do that to yourself

ESMERAx7ALZ9GN2v-tZITg.text: Came here with my SO and her Volleyball Team. We had a great time, correction Phenomenal time!!  The food was fantastic!! I had the Create Your Omelette, turkey sausage, Bacon and Hash brown. Finished it with the Red Velvet Pancakes!! The best, the absolute best best pancakes ever!!   I've been here multiple times and each time just gets better and better. I woke up the next day thinking about the red velvet pancakes. Highly recommend BabyStacks for anyone looking for multiple options for pancakes!

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. CYO Turkey Sausage, Bacon and Hashbrowns
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red Velvet Pancakes
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xMFJ5GD2yAWDXO7Ecl8vMQ.text: Located just around the corner from my place, I think I may have hit the breakfast/brunch jackpot! BabyStacks is a neat Filipino American joint that serves up a mean baby stack (or full stack!) of pancakes. Went there this morning and it didn't take too long for two of us to be seated. The service is on-point! Iced water and coffee served quickly, and the waitress came back around quickly to get our food order.  I ordered the Lolo special of adobo fried rice and an upgrade to a babystack of Oreo pancakes (aka the Cookies and Cream pancake stack, that is served with a little dish of cream cheese drizzle). Pancakes were yummy, reminding me of chocolate cake batter and came with crushed Oreo's on top of the whip cream. The adobo fried rice came wrapped in an omelet looking get-up. I'm not mad about the adobo fried rice, for sure. I think the eggs might need some pepper, salt, and/or hot sauce. Good thing they bring hot sauce and ketchup to the table, so that helped!   I'm looking forward to returning and trying other pancakes and other Filipino American food. Gotta rep!

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loco moco, also a winner
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Adobo fried rice for the win, just needs a little more sauce or extra kick!
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

H17itWAcywmndh_xccEhoA.text: I can definitely see why so many locals are such big fans of the restaurant! The food here is awesome! Be prepared to wait at least 30 minutes if you are making a trip over here on the weekend.   I highly recommend the Adobo Fried Rice as it is their main specialty. The rice and shredded chicken were very flavorful and tucked right in the eggs. The surrounding omelette was perfectly cooked and full of rich flavor. Make a visit here, and you won't be disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rvA2YlrJu14CwhL_SrIteQ.text: I've been to a BabyStacks twice while living in Vegas and cannot help but to imagine that it does so well because people want pancakes for their hangovers.  But I'll tell you that there is more than just pancakes and they do well because the breakfast/brunch food here is a real draw.  And it is more than just buttermilk pancakes as the specialize in really unique flavors and toppings.  I remember making cheap tin can versions of corned beef hash for dinner as a kid, this one is made with a much better quality of corned beef and a very pleasant balance of potato and onion.  There is onion in it and I don't like onions but this one did not taste onion-y.  I liked the kalbi short ribs and eggs and all of the pancakes were really good.  The only thing about this place that keeps me from going more often are the hours, otherwise I would probably go here for 'breakfast for dinner'

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. TLC is toffee lemon crunch
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yay
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blueberry pancakes

K4MdLWCj89SdZ6IVl2m99g.text: Having heard about this place for a while we decided to try it.  It was pretty crowded on an early Sunday afternoon, but the wait was pretty minimal (about 10 minutes or so).  The interior is a bit cramped, but it seemed clean and had pretty cool decor.  The staff were quite friendly and were always checking up on us and refilling beverages.  The menu is pretty extensive and includes a wide variety of breakfast/brunch favorites including many cool and unique pancake varieties.    I tried the corned beef hash and eggs with a side of blueberry pancakes.  Very good!  The hash was tasty and flavorful without being ridiculously salty.  The potatoes were fairly standard.  The eggs were cooked perfectly over hard just as requested.  The pancakes were fluffy and moist though didn't have quite as many blueberries inside as I would have liked.  Some blueberry compote on top would've made a nice finishing touch also, but it did come with some fresh blueberries placed atop the pancakes.   Overall this was a very enjoyable and satisfying meal!  Keep in mind it is strictly a breakfast/brunch place as they close fairly early in the afternoon (I think around 3pm).

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned beef hash and eggs with blueberry pancakes
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Reception area
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Interior on a Sunday at 1pm

Pn5BNQ98SVUNKIKDmXAIWA.text: I usually go to the BabyStacks Cafe up at the Centennial location, but my family was down near this BabyStacks Cafe.  I wasn't disappointed!!! We came in a hour before closing, so there was spacious seating available! We were promptly seated and provided drinks.  We ordered the following off of the Babystacks menu -  Kids Meal: Egg, Pancake, Sausage, (Substitute potatoes for a biscuit) Chicken Fried Steak with Scrambled eggs and Sourdough Toast Mochi Pancakes (Special)  All of it was prepared within 20 minutes upon placing the order. My daughter ate her entire meal! She thought it was delicious. None of her food was overcooked or under-cooked.   My chicken fried steak was cooked appropriately. The gravy was flavorful and not too oily. There was enough gravy on the chicken fried steak where it wasn't too overpowering of the meal. The scrambled eggs were cooked and didn't taste like processed eggs. The Sourdough toast was drenched with butter, just the way I like it!   The Mochi Pancakes was actually delightful. I wasn't sure what to expect, but the Mochi flavoring was on-target. The whip-cream that was on-top of the pancakes was just enough. I only had a few bites from my boyfriend's Mochi Pancakes, but those few bites tasted great! It was quite filling. I would order Mochi pancakes again from Babystacks if they put it on their menu, instead of just a special.  Great food, great service! I'll be back to this location again!

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YBCcbGx-xQhlKBzdteN7kw.text: I've had this place bookmarked for the longest time & finally tried it out! Came around noon and our party of 2 was seated right away. Our server, Loreal, was very friendly and attentive. My friend ordered the steak and eggs, which were good. I ordered the adobo omlette and upgraded to the banana cream pancakes for $1.50, which is a pretty decent price to upgrade to their signature stacks. The adobo omlette was yummy. I just wish the omlette to rice ratio was better. There was much less adobo rice compared to the omlette. If I'm ever in the area again, I'll for sure come back!

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steam &amp; eggs, banana cream pancakes, and adobo omlette

Eedao21_pH8d7nelM1NzBw.text: I love this place! Talk about breakfast with a Filipino twist! One of the best places in Vegas to get breakfast to satisfy both your sweet and savory cravings. If you are looking for the perfect pancake, I'm pretty sure this is the restaurant that makes their pancakes look as good as they taste. Every time I order pancakes at a breakfast place, I'm always hesitant because I am not a fan of dry pancakes. Babystacks definitely has mastered the art of pancake making, their pancakes are soft, moist, and sweet. Highly recommend the Red Velvet pancakes. If there is anything you go here for it's the pancakes! Their omelettes here are pretty tasty too. Also, if you've never tried a grilled cheese sandwich with pulled pork - it is a must!    This place can get pretty busy, so try to come here on non-busy days such as the weekday. It's roomy, so don't be shy to come here with your brunch group.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red velvet pancakes
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huntington omelette
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled cheese sandwich with pulled pork

WYfXLCjGXz7zPRhys5ywNw.text: Great food! Love coming here. Everyone is friendly, service is great and the red velvet pancakes are my favorite!  I usually enjoy breakfast just about every day! I love eggs, bacon and toast with jam. But once in a while I love to switch things up, get an omelette, some pancakes.   Today I tried the ranchero omelet, a little chicken some cheese and a great green chili sauce. I loved the omelette, hash browns looked great but had only one crispy side and a bit mushy on the other. But the real star was the red velvet pancakes!   They are so good, rich chocolate with whipped cream and cream cheese frosting syrup. Almost too sweet. Overall, a great meal!

X82gODCoq08rknaxeSwKhQ.text: When I'm not counting calories - which is often the case when I'm eating delicious, satisfying, tummy-fulfilling food - I come to BabyStacks Cafe.  The good thing about it being near, is that I can go any day. The bad thing about it being near, is that I can go any day!   The servings are always generous. I come away with to-go containers for later. Like maybe 10 minutes later! Today's orders were equally generous and delicious: Portuguese Fried Rice - omelette with sausage & mushrooms. Did I see some Spam cubes? Winner!  And Bananas Foster. Yes, you can have your fruit and pancake, too!.  Attentive service is always courteous and comes with a smile. Thank you, Amanda & Alejo. Thanks also to the cashier/host, the guy who cleared the tables, and the kitchen staff. You are all awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Have your fruit and pancake, too? Sure, why not!
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Portuguese Rice with sausage. What better way to have your rice than served omelette-style!
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I always have a banana for breakfast. This just happens to come with pancakes. LOL!

Lpg78fdiVLu2UvV_af6JOg.text: This place is just adorable! I didn't think I was going to be as impressed as we were but WOW... Just Wow! My friend and I decided to split a breakfast ( which we got the Adobo Omelette along with and upgrade to a short stack of Bananas foster.  As far as the Omelette it had a nice amount of flavor with plenty of fried rice and meat inside . It was very good. BUT the star of the show were the bananas fosters!! OMG!!!! I want to curse but I'm going to "keep it classy San Diego" who would've thought to do a bananas fosters pancakes! There were pretty AmazinG! Great recommendations by one of the servers.  Splitting the food was more than enough for 2.   They have a really nice variety of pancakes , eggs etc options and we will definitely be  back!!

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Adobo Omelette
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bananas Fosters Pancakes

W-WRs2JZtWBrVqsU0WL0eQ.text: If you come here, you must order the Red Velvet Pancakes! Not too sweet, fluffy, and unique. The cream cheese sauce was AMAZING! We ordered a short stack and wish I got the full. If ordering the full, I would probably recommend ordering extra sauce. The small cup we had was perfect for the short, but it wouldn't have been enough for the full (my kids came with the same size container for the full).   The Kalua Pork Benedict was also a favorite at the table. I would also order it again! My husband and I shared this with the pancakes and it was the perfect mix of savory and sweet.  We ordered our kids a full order of s'mores pancakes to share. Don't get me wrong, they were delicious, but didn't compare to the other two. My kids devoured their plates though!

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red Velvet Pancakes
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. S&#39;mores pancakes
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalua Pork Benedict

o3i4zBhFJ84mZqDN_BzXWw.text: I've been wanting to try this place out because everyone hypes it up so much, so this was the first food stop my friends and I went to when we got to Las Vegas.   The establishment was a decent size, and it took less than 20 minutes for our party of 9 to be seated. Mind you, we got here pretty early, probably around 9am, so it might be busier later in on the afternoon. The servers were very friendly and efficient which made the experience a lot better.  The Lolo Rick's Adobo fried rice is one of the local's favorites, along with the red velvet pancakes so that is what I ordered. They have so many different pancake flavors it's so hard to choose which one to try. I definitely wanted to try them all! The red velvet pancakes were delicious! The consistency was perfect! The pancakes were fluffy and they're a good size for one person. The icing that is served with it makes it super sweet so I recommend only using a little bit. I must say, I was kind of disappointed about the adobo fried rice. It comes as an omelette that is stuffed with the adobo fried rice, it was good, but it wasn't great. I feel like the flavors were pretty bland and not that enjoyable.   Overall, I would definitely come back to try more of the pancakes that they have and I recommend people try this place out as well!

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red velvet, Oreo, &amp; orange creamsicle pancakes
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lolo Rick&#39;s adobo fried rice

YYMkZRFd6dmllV102dIL5g.text: We picked this place from the reviews and it was definitely spot on! This is an easy drive from the strip in a very nice part of town. The restaurant itself is small but plenty of customers for early morning. We wanted to have a Filipino breakfast so we started out with the adobo rice omelette and skillet. We also upgraded to red velvet and bananas foster pancakes. They were just the right size. The omelette was a very good portion too. Even if the pancakes looked sweet it wasn't. Again we were impressed on how fresh and tasty the food was here. The service was also very good. I will definitely return next time we are in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bananas Carmel sauce not too sweet it was perfect
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Skillet
Photo of BabyStacks Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Adobo rice omelette their specialty

XnOJw27GgskXs9nazl6oeg.text: Breakfast/ brunch is probably my favorite meal of the day and BabyStacks did not disappoint. I came here with a group of 9 people and although it was quite busy, we were seated in about 15 minutes. Our waitress was super friendly and efficient, and had our orders out super fast and correctly. I ordered the regular eggs benedict, which is by far my favorite breakfast food, fun fact, and although it was good it wasn't the best I've had.  However, I tried my friends' pancakes and regretted not getting them because WOW best pancakes I've ever had and I'm not even a fan of pancakes like that, breakfast blasphemy I know. The cookies and cream, and red velvet flavors were amazing! Next time I'm definitely going to have to try the many other signature flavors they have, seriously try them you won't be disappointed!

tJXwR0mI-ker-fGGt9xz8w.text: Stopped by for a late breakfast with my boyfriend. We always come here for breakfast! And for some odd reason Amanda is always our server, from what I can remember.  It was pretty busy and almost about closing time so a lot of people were checking out.  Amanda, with a friendly smile, came up and asked us if we were ready.  I ordered the veggie omelet with blueberry pancakes and my boyfriend did too with just regular pancakes.  Food came out in a timely manner and Amanda did a wonderful job checking back on us or getting us things we needed. She is a very attentive and sweet server!  My food was super delicious! It was even better with the garlic friend rice to go along with my eggs.   I always leave here super happy and full! Never any complaints about BabyStacks!

exYJqWiZTtRK6dmIbAqU5g.text: Ordered to have well done/ crispy portuguese sausage but most of them was rather burnt while the other pieces wasn't close to crispy.  The chili felt mushy and with no beans???  Never ever in my life have I ate chili with no beans.  Disappointed with this order.  Other foods I had in past was great but next time when I want portuguese sausage and chili I'll just remember to go Egg Works for that!

V0WVsIVDgL4BYVlQv3A9hw.text: Before Babystacks, I wasn't a fan of pancakes. After trying it, I realized this is my new favorite breakfast spot.  My friend was in town and wanted to try this place out. He wanted pancakes and I went along because I figured they don't have Only pancakes, right? Right!  I ordered the "HM1 (FMF)" (pork, bacon, green onions, cilantro, Swiss cheese; $9.50). Not sure why it's called that and neither did our server lol. Whatever though, because it was delish.  A cool thing about ordering is how easy it is to customize. My HM1 could come as either an omelette or skillet, egg whites upgrade, or even an upgrade to their signature babystacks. I went with this last option because, why not? I chose the red velvet and, wow... I'm a fan of pancakes again!  Came back again this morning as it is my birthday. I took my friend here so I could have a Babystacks as a breakfast birthday cake lol. Great spot and I look forward to trying all the flavors.
